hal
  • Reference

Highly Adaptive Lasso

Model fitting function.

hal(Y, X, newX = NULL, family = gaussian(), verbose = F,
  obsWeights = rep(1, length(Y)), sparseMat = TRUE,
  nfolds = ifelse(length(Y) <= 100, 20, 10), nlambda = 100, useMin = TRUE,
  debug = T, parallel = F, ...)

Arguments

Y
outcome
X
data
newX
New data to apply the model fit and generate predictions.
family
Statistical family
verbose
Set to T for more detailed output
obsWeights
observation weights
sparseMat
Use sparse matrix implementation or normal matrix implementation. Normal matrix implementation is old and not guaranteed to work correctly.
nfolds
Number of CV folds for cv.glmnet
nlambda
Number of lambda values to test in cv.glmnet.
useMin
Glmnet option - use minimum risk lambda or 1se lambda (more penalization).
debug
Setting to T will run garbage collection to improve the accuracy of memory monitoring.
parallel
Use a regisered parallel backend if possible.

Contents

  • Arguments

Developed by David Benkeser, Chris Kennedy.
